oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soil organic carbon as an indicator of soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schjønning, P.
Munkholm, L.J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop combinations and interactions
Composting and manuring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Agricultural use of soil influences the content of soil organic carbon (SOC). Arable farming will reduce SOC compared with permanent grass. The crop rotation has a major influence on SOC, a high frequency of annual cash crops giving rise to a reduction compared with forage cropping including grass leys
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schjønning, P. and Munkholm, L.J. (2004) Soil organic carbon as an indicator of soil quality. DARCOFenews (3).
